name: BeansView
0:
”Alexa, show the baby room”
”Alexa, show the front door”
”Alexa, hide the front door”
skdetail:
Smart Home Skill. This skill may share device information with Amazon. Learn more.
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Developer Terms of Use
des:
With Beans View skill and Alexa, you can now interact with your Beans View connected cameras using your voice. 
Follow the steps below to setup your camera and link your Beans View account:
From the Beans View Mobile App, select a suitable name for your camera (i.e., baby room, front door, etc.)
From the Beans View Mobile App, disable Image Encryption for the camera you wish to setup
From your Alexa App, search for Beans View, enable the skill and link it to your Beans View account by signing in with your Beans View account
Discover your cameras by asking Alexa “Discover devices” or by pressing the Discover Devices button in the Alexa app
Once your account is linked, viewing your cameras is supported on Amazon Echo Show, Echo Spot, Fire TV, 2nd Gen Fire Stick or Fire Tablets (7th gen and above). To see your camera, just say “Alexa, show the (camera name)”
Some important notes:
• Before connecting to Amazon Echo Show, Echo Spot or Fire TV, log in to your Beans View App and go to the camera settings. Look for “Image Encryption” and tap to turn it off. Tap “OK” when the prompt appears. Enter the Verification Code to apply the change.
• How to change the name of your Beans View camera: Once the camera has been added to your Beans View account, you can change its name in the Beans View camera settings page. Select a suitable name for your camera, such as “baby room” or “front door.”
• You can view live feeds from Beans View cameras on your Amazon Echo Show or Fire TV by saying the command “Alexa, show the (camera name).”
